description.narrative: Output 3.2: By the end of 2021, national and subnational capacities in the design and implementation of integrated child-sensitive social protection programmes are enhanced., which contributes to Child Poverty / Public Finance For Children, Child Poverty / Public Finance For Children (Covid), Children With Disabilities, Economic And Social Policy General, Public Finance And Local Governance, Social Protection, Social Protection (Covid), Social Protection And Child Poverty. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Outcome 3: By the end of 2021, the most disadvantaged children benefit from enhanced evidence-based and integrated social protection and poverty reduction policies, programmes and institutions

sector.narrative: Cash Transfers: Technical support to government cash transfer system development and expansion (design, targeting, beneficiary selection, grievance mechanism, cash delivery mechanisms like banking, mobiles, community distribution)

Social protection and welfare services policy, planning and administration
Support to other social protection programs: Child care and early childhood development

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

description.narrative: UNICEF supported Ministry of Cooperative Labor & Social Welfare (MCLSW) to enhance national and sub-national capacities in the design and implementation of integrated child-sensitive social protection programmes. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:13/08/2020

title.narrative: Number of households benefitting from new or additional social assistance measures provided by governments to respond to COVID-19 with UNICEF support [COVIDSitRep]
Level of use of child poverty data to plan social protection policies and programmes for children
(NOT VALID after Dec 31 2017) Child poverty is explicitly included as part of a national developmen plan or similar, such as a standalone child poverty action plan
Exsistence of a national coordiantion mechanisms on children and adolescent with disabilities

actual.value: 2020:Situation Analysis of Children Living with disability completed. Series of advocacy efforts resulted in formalizing planned interventions through signing of a workplan with the State Welfare Organization

title.narrative: Nationally owned measurement of the share of public spending in health, education and/or social protection benefiting children in households living in the poorest region and/or the poorest quintile is in place for use in policy development
M and E: Monitoring and evaluation mechanisms are used to follow up on social protection delivery/system
